ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic triad of autism, intellectual disability, and seizures. Most common inherited cause of intellectual disability and autism spectrum disorder.
Characterized by severe intellectual disability, seizures (often tonic-clonic), and autistic behaviors. Classic neurodevelopmental disorder with this phenotype.
TSC1 mutations cause autism (40-50% of cases), intellectual disability, and epilepsy including tonic-clonic seizures. Common genetic cause of this triad.
TSC2 mutations present similarly to TSC1 with autism, intellectual disability, and seizures, but may have more severe phenotype.
Features autism-like behaviors, moderate to severe intellectual disability, and seizures. More common in females but can occur in males with severe presentation.
22q13.3 deletion syndrome presenting with autism, intellectual disability, and seizures in about 40% of cases.
X-linked disorder with severe intellectual disability, autistic features, and epilepsy including tonic-clonic seizures.
Severe epilepsy syndrome with tonic-clonic seizures, intellectual disability, and autistic features developing after seizure onset.
